headings.usage: Landing page headlines, modal titles, major section headers

rules: Overlines must be uppercase with wide spacing (tracking-widest)
Line height: tight for headers, relaxed for body

buttons.default: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 rounded-sm px-6 py-2 font-medium transition-all active:scale-95
buttons.ghost: hover:bg-accent/10 hover:text-accent text-foreground rounded-sm px-4 py-2 transition-colors
buttons.outline: border border-input bg-background hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground rounded-sm px-6 py-2 transition-colors

cards.style: bg-card text-card-foreground border border-border shadow-sm rounded-none

inputs.style: flex h-10 w-full rounded-sm border border-input bg-background px-3 py-2 text-sm ring-offset-background file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium placeholder:text-muted-foreground focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50

toolbar.style: h-12 border-b border-border bg-background/80 backdrop-blur-md flex items-center px-4 gap-2 sticky top-0 z-50

images.description: Abstract white wavy shapes for hero background or subtle overlay

accessibility.contrast: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for normal text
accessibility.focus_states: Visible focus rings on all interactive elements

instructions_to_main_agent: Use the 'Swiss & High-Contrast' archetype. Avoid gradients.
Implement a 'Split View' for the editor: Left for code, Right for preview.
Use 'Chivo' for headings and 'Public Sans' for UI text.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for the code editor.
Apply a subtle noise texture to the background to mimic paper.
Use sharp borders (rounded-none or rounded-sm) for a professional tool look.
Ensure the toolbar is sticky and uses glassmorphism.
Use the provided image URLs for backgrounds where appropriate.
Add data-testid to all interactive elements.
universal_guidelines: Create depth through z-index and subtle borders.
Do not center align the app container.
